png

Class PngParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • common.AbstractImageParser
      • png.PngParser

  • public class PngParser
extends AbstractImageParser
    This program aims to read PNG image files and retrieve data structured in a series of chunks. For accessing metadata, only any of the textual chunks or the EXIF chunk, if present, will be processed. Normally, most PNG files do not contain the EXIF structure, however, it will attempt to search for these 4 potential chunks: ChunkType.eXIf, ChunkType.tEXt, ChunkType.iTXt or ChunkType.zTXt.

    PNG Data Stream

    The PNG data stream begins with a PNG SIGNATURE (0x89 0x50 0x4E 0x47 0x0D 0x0A 0x1A 0x0A) followed by a series of chunks. Each chunk consists of:

    • 4 bytes for data field length (unsigned, usually <= 31 bytes)
    • 4 bytes for chunk type (only [65-90] and [97-122]) ASCII codes
    • Variable number of bytes for data field
    • 4 bytes for CRC computed from chunk type and data only

    There are two categories of chunks: Critical and Ancillary.

    Critical Chunk Types

    • IHDR - image header, always the initial chunk in the data stream
    • PLTE - palette table, relevant for indexed PNG images
    • IDAT - image data chunk, multiple occurrences likely
    • IEND - image trailer, always the final chunk in the data stream

    Ancillary Chunk Types

    • Transparency info: tRNS
    • Colour space info: cHRM, gAMA, iCCP, sBIT, sRGB
    • Textual info: iTXt, tEXt, zTXt
    • Miscellaneous info: bKGD, hIST, pHYs, sPLT
    • Time info: tIME

    Chunk Processing

    • Only chunks of specified types in the requiredChunks list are read
    • An empty requiredChunks list results in no data being extracted from the source stream
    • A null list results in all data being copied from the source stream
    Since:
    13 August 2025
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs

    • Method Detail

      • readMetadata

        public Metadata<? extends BaseMetadata> readMetadata()
                                              throws ImageReadErrorException
        Parses data in the PNG image file and returns a new Metadata object. It is important to note that PNG files usually do not have an EXIF segment block structured inside. However, it will attempt to find information from 4 possible chunks: ChunkType.eXIf, ChunkType.tEXt, ChunkType.iTXt or ChunkType.zTXt. The last 3 chunks are textual. If any of these 3 textual chunks does contain data, it will be quite rudimentary, such as obtaining the Creation Time, Last Modification Date, etc. See https://www.w3.org/TR/png/#11keywords for more information.
        Specified by:
        readMetadata in class AbstractImageParser
        Returns:
        a Metadata object containing extracted metadata
        Throws:
        ImageReadErrorException - in case of processing errors

      • getSafeMetadata

        public Metadata<? extends BaseMetadata> getSafeMetadata()
        Retrieves previously parsed metadata from the PNG file.
        Specified by:
        getSafeMetadata in class AbstractImageParser
        Returns:
        a populated Metadata object, or an empty one if no metadata was found

      • getImageFormat

        public DigitalSignature getImageFormat()
        Returns the detected PNG format.
        Specified by:
        getImageFormat in class AbstractImageParser
        Returns:
        a DigitalSignature enum constant representing this image format

      • formatDiagnosticString

        public java.lang.String formatDiagnosticString()
        Generates a human-readable diagnostic string for PNG metadata.

        This includes textual chunks (tEXt, iTXt, zTXt) and optional EXIF data (from the eXIf chunk if present).

        Overrides:
        formatDiagnosticString in class AbstractImageParser
        Returns:
        a formatted string suitable for diagnostics, logging, or inspection
